section.title: Database setup
section.para: After installation of a database management system you need to create the database itself, create users and grant access to the database. Some database management system create defaults but it is good to know how to create them yourself.

section.title: Database schema
section.para: The following explains the creation, deletion and usage of database schemas.

row.entry: List all the databases on the SQL server
Creates a new database with the name my_database
Show all schemas in this database
Shows all tables for the database schema "myschema".

section.title: User Maintenance
section.para: The following demonstrate how to create a user and how to grant access rights to a user.

row.entry: Creates a user my_user on the database with the password my_password;
grant usage on *.* to my_user@localhost identified by 'my_password';
Allows the user my_user to connect to the database.
grant all privileges on my_database.* to my_user@localhost;
Allows the user my_user from the localhost full access to my_database
